goal.core.mentalstate

Class MentalModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • goal.core.mentalstate.MentalModel

  • public class MentalModel
extends java.lang.Object
    A MentalModel is a belief base and a stack of goal bases. The top of the goal-base-stack represents the current focus. It is part of the MentalState (which also contains mailbox and perceptbase).

    An agent can maintain mental models not only for itself but also for other agents. This is why we need to be able to create multiple instances of MentalModels which are stored in the MentalState.

    Author:
    K.Hindriks

      • addBase

        public void addBase(AgentId owner,
           AgentId agentName,
           KRlanguage language,
           java.util.Set<DatabaseFormula> content,
           BASETYPE type)
             throws KRInitFailedException
        Adds a BeliefBase of type BASETYPE to this MentalModel. Use #addGoalBase(String, KRlanguage, Set, BASETYPE) to add a goal base!
        Parameters:
        owner - The name of the agent that owns this MentalModel.
        agentName - The name of the agent whose beliefs, etc. are represented in this mental model.
        language - The KRlanguage used for representing formulas in the belief base.
        content - The content, i.e. a set of DatabaseFormulas, to be added to the base.
        type - The BASETYPE of the base.
        Throws:
        KRInitFailedException - If the KR technology was unable to create the requested database for storing formulas of the particular type.

      • getAttentionSet

        protected GoalBase getAttentionSet(boolean use)
        Returns either the current attention set that the agent focuses on or else the top level goal base of the agent.
        Parameters:
        use - true if we want to use the current focus; false if we want to use the top level goal base.
        Returns:
        The current attention set, or the top level goal base.

        Returns:
        The attention stack.

      • query

        public final java.util.Set<Substitution> query(MentalLiteral literal,
                                boolean focus,
                                Debugger debugger)
        Checks if a mental atom follows from the belief and/or goal base. A mental atom is a literal such as "bel(...)" or "goal(...)".
        Parameters:
        literal - the mental atom to be checked.
        debugger - The debugger controlling the call
        focus - is true if we need to use current focus, or false if we need to reset to global focus.
        Returns:
        a list of substitutions that when applied to the mental atom result in instances of it that follow from the belief and/or goal base. If the mental atom is closed, and follows from the mental state, then pSubst is an empty list.

      • beliefQuery

        public final java.util.Set<Substitution> beliefQuery(Query query,
                                      Debugger debugger)
        Evaluates a query on the belief base.
        Parameters:
        query - formula to be queried.
        debugger - The debugger controlling the call
        Returns:
        (possibly empty) set of substitutions that when applied to the formula ensure it follows from the belief base.

      • goalQuery

        public final java.util.Set<Substitution> goalQuery(Query query,
                                    boolean focus,
                                    Debugger debugger)
        Evaluates a query on the goal base.
        Parameters:
        query - formula to be queried.
        focus - is true if we need to use current focus, or false if we need to reset to global focus.
        debugger - The debugger controlling the call
        Returns:
        (possibly empty) set of substitutions that when applied to the formula ensure it follows from the goal base.

      • agoalQuery

        public final java.util.Set<Substitution> agoalQuery(Query query,
                                     boolean focus,
                                     Debugger debugger)
        Evaluates a query on the goal and belief base.
        Parameters:
        query - formula to be queried.
        focus - is true if we need to use current focus, or false if we need to reset to global focus.
        debugger - The debugger controlling the call
        Returns:
        (possibly empty) set of substitutions that when applied to formula ensure it follows from the goal base but NOT from the belief base.

      • goalaQuery

        public final java.util.Set<Substitution> goalaQuery(Query query,
                                     boolean focus,
                                     Debugger debugger)
        Evaluates a query on the goal and belief base.
        Parameters:
        query - formula to be queried.
        focus - is true if we need to use current focus, or false if we need to reset to global focus.
        debugger - The debugger controlling the call
        Returns:
        (possibly empty) set of substitutions that when applied to formula ensure it follows from the goal base AND from the belief base.

      • drop

        public void drop(Update goal,
        Debugger debugger)
        Removes all goals from each GoalBase in the attention set goalBases from which the goal to be dropped can be derived.
        Parameters:
        goal - The goal to be dropped.
        debugger - Debugger observing the procedure.

      • updateGoalState

        public void updateGoalState(Debugger debugger)
        Implements the blind commitment strategy of a GOAL agent. It removes goals when they are believed to be achieved completely. For efficiency reasons, this method should be called only twice: (i) after updating a mental state with percepts, and (ii) after performing an action.
        If no goals are present in the goal base after removing achieved goals, it is attempted to de-focus the agent from the module currently focused on, up to a module where goals are present again (or the top-level module).
        Parameters:
        debugger - The debugger controlling the call

      • printAttentionStack

        public java.lang.String printAttentionStack()
        Returns:
        A string representation of the stack of attention sets stored in this MentalModel. Contains the results of GoalBase.showContents() for all sets.

      • focus

        protected void focus(GoalBase attentionSet,
         Debugger debugger)
        Makes the agent to which this model belongs focus its attention on a certain set of goals. The current set of goals are put on hold until defocus(Debugger) is called.

        It is assumed #preFocus(String) is already called, as that was necessary to construct the goal base more easily.

        Parameters:
        attentionSet - The set of goals the agent will focus on.
        debugger - The debugger monitoring the focusing.

      • defocus

        public void defocus(Debugger debugger)
        De-focuses the attention of the agent to which this model belongs to. This also removes any achieved goals from the goal base the agent de-focuses to (that is, any achieved goals the agent temporarily ignored because it was focused on something else).
        This method does nothing if the agent is not focused on anything.
        Parameters:
        debugger - The current debugger.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string representation of this MentalModel.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A string representation of the mental model.

      • getTimeUsedByKR

        public long getTimeUsedByKR()
        Returns the time used to perform queries and updates on this BeliefBase in this thread by the KR language.
        Returns:
        The time used in this thread to perform queries on this belief base by the KR language.

      • getCount

        public long getCount()
        Returns the total number of queries and updates that have been performed on this BeliefBase while executing a GOAL agent.
        Returns:
        The total number of queries performed on this belief base.
